verses.verse: ( The Parable of the Wicked Tenants) ( ( 470 21:33-46 ; 490 20:9-18 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai Then ἤρξατο <WG756> ērxato [Jesus] began αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois to them ἐν <WG1722> en in παραβολαῖς <WG3850> parabolais parables : λαλεῖν <WG2980> lalein to speak Ἀμπελῶνα <WG290> Ampelōna a vineyard . ἄνθρωπος <WG444> anthrōpos “ A man ἐφύτευσεν <WG5452> ephyteusen planted καὶ <WG2532> kai - περιέθηκεν <WG4060> periethēken He put φραγμὸν <WG5418> phragmon a wall around it , καὶ <WG2532> kai - ὤρυξεν <WG3736> ōryxen dug ὑπολήνιον <WG5276> hypolēnion a wine vat , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ᾠκοδόμησεν <WG3618> ōkodomēsen built πύργον <WG4444> pyrgon a watchtower . καὶ <WG2532> kai Then ἐξέδετο <WG1554> exedeto he rented it out αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . γεωργοῖς <WG1092> geōrgois to [some] tenants καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀπεδήμησεν <WG589> apedēmēsen went away on a journey .

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai - ἀπέστειλεν <WG649> apesteilen he sent πρὸς <WG4314> pros to τοὺς <WG3588> tous the γεωργοὺς <WG1092> geōrgous tenants τῷ <WG3588> tō - καιρῷ <WG2540> kairō At harvest time , δοῦλον <WG1401> doulon a servant ἵνα <WG2443> hina to παρὰ <WG3844> para - τῶν <WG3588> tōn - γεωργῶν <WG1092> geōrgōn - λάβῃ <WG2983> labē collect ἀπὸ <WG575> apo [his share] of τῶν <WG3588> tōn the καρπῶν <WG2590> karpōn fruit τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the ἀμπελῶνος <WG290> ampelōnos vineyard .

καὶ <WG2532> kai But λαβόντες <WG2983> labontes they seized αὐτὸν <WG846> auton [the servant] , ἔδειραν <WG1194> edeiran beat [him] , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀπέστειλαν <WG649> apesteilan sent [him] away κενόν <WG2756> kenon empty-handed .

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai Then πάλιν <WG3825> palin - ἀπέστειλεν <WG649> apesteilen he sent πρὸς <WG4314> pros - αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them ἄλλον <WG243> allon another δοῦλον <WG1401> doulon servant , κἀκεῖνον <WG2548> kakeinon and ἐκεφαλίωσαν <WG2775> ekephaliōsan they struck him over the head καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἠτίμασαν <WG818> ētimasan treated [him] shamefully .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἄλλον <WG243> allon still another , ἀπέστειλεν <WG649> apesteilen He sent κἀκεῖνον <WG2548> kakeinon and this one ἀπέκτειναν <WG615> apekteinan they killed . καὶ <WG2532> kai [He sent] πολλοὺς <WG4183> pollous many ἄλλους <WG243> allous others ; οὓς <WG3739> hous some μὲν <WG3303> men - δέροντες <WG1194> derontes they beat οὓς <WG3739> hous [others] δὲ <WG1161> de and ἀποκτέννοντες <WG615> apoktennontes they killed .

Ἔτι <WG2089> Eti vvv ἕνα <WG1520> hena one εἶχεν <WG2192> eichen having υἱὸν <WG5207> huion son , ἀγαπητόν <WG27> agapēton beloved ἀπέστειλεν <WG649> apesteilen he sent αὐτὸν <WG846> auton him ἔσχατον <WG2078> eschaton Finally , πρὸς <WG4314> pros to αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them . λέγων <WG3004> legōn he said ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - . Ἐντραπήσονται <WG1788> Entrapēsontai ‘ They will respect τὸν <WG3588> ton - υἱόν <WG5207> huion son , ’ μου <WG1473> mou my

Ἐκεῖνοι <WG1565> Ekeinoi [the] δὲ <WG1161> de But οἱ <WG3588> hoi - γεωργοὶ <WG1092> geōrgoi tenants πρὸς <WG4314> pros to ἑαυτοὺς <WG1438> heautous one another εἶπαν <WG2036> eipan said ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - , Οὗτός <WG3778> Houtos ‘ This ἐστιν <WG1510> estin is ὁ <WG3588> ho the κληρονόμος <WG2818> klēronomos heir . δεῦτε <WG1205> deute Come , ἀποκτείνωμεν <WG615> apokteinōmen let us kill αὐτόν <WG846> auton him , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἡμῶν <WG1473> hēmōn ours . ’ ἔσται <WG1510> estai will be ἡ <WG3588> hē the κληρονομία <WG2817> klēronomia inheritance

καὶ <WG2532> kai So λαβόντες <WG2983> labontes they seized [the son] , ἀπέκτειναν <WG615> apekteinan killed αὐτόν <WG846> auton him , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐξέβαλον <WG1544> exebalon threw αὐτὸν <WG846> auton him ἔξω <WG1854> exō out τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the ἀμπελῶνος <WG290> ampelōnos vineyard .

Τί <WG5101> Ti What [οὖν] <WG3767> oun then ποιήσει <WG4160> poiēsei do ? ὁ <WG3588> ho will the κύριος <WG2962> kyrios owner τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the ἀμπελῶνος <WG290> ampelōnos vineyard ἐλεύσεται <WG2064> eleusetai He will come καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀπολέσει <WG622> apolesei kill τοὺς <WG3588> tous [those] γεωργούς <WG1092> geōrgous tenants , καὶ <WG2532> kai and δώσει <WG1325> dōsei will give τὸν <WG3588> ton the ἀμπελῶνα <WG290> ampelōna vineyard ἄλλοις <WG243> allois to others .

οὐδὲ <WG3761> oude vvv τὴν <WG3588> tēn - γραφὴν <WG1124> graphēn Scripture : ταύτην <WG3778> tautēn this ἀνέγνωτε <WG314> anegnōte Have you never read Λίθον <WG3037> Lithon ‘ [The] stone ὃν <WG3739> hon - ἀπεδοκίμασαν <WG593> apedokimasan rejected οἱ <WG3588> hoi the οἰκοδομοῦντες <WG3618> oikodomountes builders Οὗτος <WG3778> Houtos - ἐγενήθη <WG1096> egenēthē has become εἰς <WG1519> eis the κεφαλὴν <WG2776> kephalēn vvv γωνίας <WG1137> gōnias cornerstone .

Παρὰ <WG3844> Para from Κυρίου <WG2962> Kyriou [the] Lord , ἐγένετο <WG1096> egeneto is αὕτη <WG3778> hautē This Καὶ <WG2532> Kai and ἔστιν <WG1510> estin it is θαυμαστὴ <WG2298> thaumastē marvelous ἐν <WG1722> en in ὀφθαλμοῖς <WG3788> ophthalmois eyes ’ ?” ( ) ἡμῶν <WG1473> hēmōn our

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai At this , ἐζήτουν <WG2212> ezētoun [the leaders] sought ( Literally they sought) αὐτὸν <WG846> auton [Jesus] , κρατῆσαι <WG2902> kratēsai to arrest καὶ <WG2532> kai But ἐφοβήθησαν <WG5399> ephobēthēsan fearing τὸν <WG3588> ton the ὄχλον <WG3793> ochlon crowd , ἔγνωσαν <WG1097> egnōsan they knew γὰρ <WG1063> gar for ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that πρὸς <WG4314> pros against αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them . τὴν <WG3588> tēn [this] παραβολὴν <WG3850> parabolēn parable εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen He had spoken καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἀφέντες <WG863> aphentes they left αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him ἀπῆλθον <WG565> apēlthon [and] went away .

( Paying Taxes to Caesar) ( ( 470 22:15-22 ; 490 20:19-26 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai Later , ἀποστέλλουσιν <WG649> apostellousin they sent πρὸς <WG4314> pros - αὐτόν <WG846> auton - τινας <WG5100> tinas some τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the Φαρισαίων <WG5330> Pharisaiōn Pharisees καὶ <WG2532> kai and τῶν <WG3588> tōn - Ἡρῳδιανῶν <WG2265> Hērōdianōn Herodians ἵνα <WG2443> hina to αὐτὸν <WG846> auton [Jesus] ἀγρεύσωσιν <WG64> agreusōsin catch λόγῳ <WG3056> logō in [His] words .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐλθόντες <WG2064> elthontes vvv λέγουσιν <WG3004> legousin they said αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . . , Διδάσκαλε <WG1320> Didaskale “ Teacher , ” οἴδαμεν <WG1492> oidamen “ we know ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that ἀληθὴς <WG227> alēthēs honest εἶ <WG1510> ei You are καὶ <WG2532> kai and οὐ <WG3756> ou vvv μέλει <WG3199> melei seek favor σοι <WG4771> soi - περὶ <WG4012> peri from οὐδενός <WG3762> oudenos no one . οὐ <WG3756> ou vvv γὰρ <WG1063> gar Indeed , βλέπεις <WG991> blepeis You are impartial εἰς <WG1519> eis . . . πρόσωπον <WG4383> prosōpon . . . ἀνθρώπων <WG444> anthrōpōn . . . ἀλλ’ <WG235> all’ [and] ἐπ’ <WG1909> ep’ in accordance with ἀληθείας <WG225> alētheias [the] truth . τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ὁδὸν <WG3598> hodon way τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God διδάσκεις <WG1321> didaskeis teach ἔξεστιν <WG1832> exestin Is it lawful δοῦναι <WG1325> dounai to pay κῆνσον <WG2778> kēnson taxes Καίσαρι <WG2541> Kaisari to Caesar ἢ <WG2228> ē or οὔ <WG3756> ou not ? δῶμεν <WG1325> dōmen Should we pay [them] ἢ <WG2228> ē or μὴ <WG3361> mē not δῶμεν <WG1325> dōmen - ? ”

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de But εἰδὼς <WG1492> eidōs [Jesus] saw through αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn their τὴν <WG3588> tēn - ὑπόκρισιν <WG5272> hypokrisin hypocrisy εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] said αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois - , Τί <WG5101> Ti “ Why με <WG1473> me Me ? πειράζετε <WG3985> peirazete are you testing φέρετέ <WG5342> pherete Bring μοι <WG1473> moi Me δηνάριον <WG1220> dēnarion a denarius ( A denarius was customarily a day’s wage for a laborer; see .) ἵνα <WG2443> hina to ἴδω <WG3708> idō inspect . ”

οἱ <WG3588> hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de [So] ἤνεγκαν <WG5342> ēnenkan they brought [it] , καὶ <WG2532> kai and λέγει <WG3004> legei He asked αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them , Τίνος <WG5101> Tinos “ Whose ἡ <WG3588> hē - εἰκὼν <WG1504> eikōn image αὕτη <WG3778> hautē [is] this ? καὶ <WG2532> kai And ἡ <WG3588> hē [whose] ἐπιγραφή <WG1923> epigraphē inscription ? ” Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de - εἶπαν <WG2036> eipan they answered αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - . Καίσαρος <WG2541> Kaisaros “ Caesar’s , ”

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de Then Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen told αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them , Τὰ <WG3588> Ta what is Καίσαρος <WG2541> Kaisaros Caesar’s , ἀπόδοτε <WG591> apodote “ Give Καίσαρι <WG2541> Kaisari to Caesar καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὰ <WG3588> ta what is τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou God’s . ” τῷ <WG3588> tō - Θεῷ <WG2316> Theō to God Καὶ <WG2532> Kai And ἐξεθαύμαζον <WG2296> exethaumazon they marveled ἐπ’ <WG1909> ep’ at αὐτῷ <WG846> autō Him .

( The Sadducees and the Resurrection) ( ( 470 22:23-33 ; 490 20:27-40 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai Then ἔρχονται <WG2064> erchontai came Σαδδουκαῖοι <WG4523> Saddoukaioi the Sadducees , πρὸς <WG4314> pros to αὐτόν <WG846> auton [Jesus] οἵτινες <WG3748> hoitines who λέγουσιν <WG3004> legousin say ἀνάστασιν <WG386> anastasin resurrection , μὴ <WG3361> mē no εἶναι <WG1510> einai there is καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐπηρώτων <WG1905> epērōtōn questioned αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes - :

Διδάσκαλε <WG1320> Didaskale “ Teacher , Μωϋσῆς <WG3475> Mōusēs Moses ἔγραψεν <WG1125> egrapsen wrote ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin for us ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that ἐάν <WG1437> ean if τινος <WG5100> tinos a man’s ἀδελφὸς <WG80> adelphos brother ἀποθάνῃ <WG599> apothanē dies καὶ <WG2532> kai and καταλίπῃ <WG2641> katalipē leaves γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika a wife καὶ <WG2532> kai but μὴ <WG3361> mē no ἀφῇ <WG863> aphē - τέκνον <WG5043> teknon children , ἵνα <WG2443> hina - λάβῃ <WG2983> labē is to marry ὁ <WG3588> ho vvv ἀδελφὸς <WG80> adelphos [the man] αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou vvv τὴν <WG3588> tēn [his brother’s] γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika widow καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐξαναστήσῃ <WG1817> exanastēsē raise up σπέρμα <WG4690> sperma offspring τῷ <WG3588> tō for ἀδελφῷ <WG80> adelphō [him] . ( ) αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou -

ἑπτὰ <WG2033> hepta seven ἀδελφοὶ <WG80> adelphoi brothers . ἦσαν <WG1510> ēsan [Now] there were καὶ <WG2532> kai - ὁ <WG3588> ho The πρῶτος <WG4413> prōtos first [one] ἔλαβεν <WG2983> elaben married γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika . . . καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀποθνῄσκων <WG599> apothnēskōn died , οὐκ <WG3756> ouk no ἀφῆκεν <WG863> aphēken leaving σπέρμα <WG4690> sperma children .

καὶ <WG2532> kai Then ὁ <WG3588> ho the δεύτερος <WG1208> deuteros second [one] ἔλαβεν <WG2983> elaben married αὐτήν <WG846> autēn [the widow] , καὶ <WG2532> kai [but] he also died ἀπέθανεν <WG599> apethanen . . . μὴ <WG3361> mē no καταλιπὼν <WG2641> katalipōn [and] left σπέρμα <WG4690> sperma children . καὶ <WG2532> kai And ὁ <WG3588> ho the τρίτος <WG5154> tritos third [did] ὡσαύτως <WG5615> hōsautōs likewise .

καὶ <WG2532> kai In this way , οἱ <WG3588> hoi of the ἑπτὰ <WG2033> hepta seven οὐκ <WG3756> ouk none ἀφῆκαν <WG863> aphēkan left σπέρμα <WG4690> sperma [any] children . ἔσχατον <WG2078> eschaton last πάντων <WG3956> pantōn of all , καὶ <WG2532> kai And ἡ <WG3588> hē the γυνὴ <WG1135> gynē woman ἀπέθανεν <WG599> apethanen died .

ἐν <WG1722> en In τῇ <WG3588> tē the ἀναστάσει <WG386> anastasei resurrection , ὅταν <WG3752> hotan [then] ἀναστῶσιν <WG450> anastōsin . . . , ( Literally In the resurrection, when they rise,) τίνος <WG5101> tinos whose αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn . . . ἔσται <WG1510> estai will she be ? γυνή <WG1135> gynē wife οἱ <WG3588> hoi [all] γὰρ <WG1063> gar For ἑπτὰ <WG2033> hepta seven ἔσχον <WG2192> eschon were αὐτὴν <WG846> autēn to her . ” γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika married

Ἔφη <WG5346> Ephē said αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois to them , ὁ <WG3588> ho - Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus Οὐ <WG3756> Ou . . . , διὰ <WG1223> dia because τοῦτο <WG3778> touto “ vvv πλανᾶσθε <WG4105> planasthe Aren’t you mistaken μὴ <WG3361> mē vvv εἰδότες <WG1492> eidotes you do not know τὰς <WG3588> tas the γραφὰς <WG1124> graphas Scriptures μηδὲ <WG3366> mēde [or] τὴν <WG3588> tēn the δύναμιν <WG1411> dynamin power τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God ?

ὅταν <WG3752> hotan When γὰρ <WG1063> gar - ἐκ <WG1537> ek . . . νεκρῶν <WG3498> nekrōn . . . , ἀναστῶσιν <WG450> anastōsin the dead rise οὔτε <WG3777> oute vvv γαμοῦσιν <WG1060> gamousin they will neither marry οὔτε <WG3777> oute nor γαμίζονται <WG1061> gamizontai be given in marriage . ἀλλ’ <WG235> all’ Instead , εἰσὶν <WG1510> eisin they will be ὡς <WG5613> hōs like ἄγγελοι <WG32> angeloi [the] angels ἐν <WG1722> en in τοῖς <WG3588> tois - οὐρανοῖς <WG3772> ouranois heaven .

οὐκ <WG3756> ouk not ἔστιν <WG1510> estin He is Θεὸς <WG2316> Theos [the] God νεκρῶν <WG3498> nekrōn of [the] dead , ἀλλὰ <WG235> alla but ζώντων <WG2198> zōntōn of [the] living . πολὺ <WG4183> poly vvv πλανᾶσθε <WG4105> planasthe You are badly mistaken ! ”

( The Greatest Commandment) ( ( 50 6:1-19 ; 470 22:34-40 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai Now προσελθὼν <WG4334> proselthōn had come up εἷς <WG1520> heis one τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the γραμματέων <WG1122> grammateōn scribes ἀκούσας <WG191> akousas and heard αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn their συζητούντων <WG4802> syzētountōn debate . ἰδὼν* <WG3708> idōn Noticing ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - καλῶς <WG2573> kalōs how well ἀπεκρίθη <WG611> apekrithē [Jesus] had answered αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them , ἐπηρώτησεν <WG1905> epērōtēsen he asked αὐτόν <WG846> auton Him , Ποία <WG4169> Poia “ Which ἐστὶν <WG1510> estin is ἐντολὴ <WG1785> entolē commandment πρώτη <WG4413> prōtē [the] most important πάντων <WG3956> pantōn of all ? ”
